data.title: Introduces minibibs + code logic to ground bibless "hovering" buildings
data.body:
See discussion #4450

This adds little dirt-patches for Red Alert to ground bib-less hovering buildings:
Chronosphere, Iron Curtain, Missile Silo, Ore Silo, Airfield, Service Depot, and many defense buildings.
Each tileset (desert, interior, snow, temperat) has it's own special bibs; made sure interior looks good on both it's ground types, the metal and the wooden one.

Was a LOT of work, but well worth it tho, as IMO it simply looks great! I'm very pleased with the results, see screenies below.
It's also more realistic. I tend do imagine snow or grass around a building is not totally "untouched" when operating people get in and out, especially in a military base.

The minibib does not take an additional cell below the building like the normal bib, it only acts as background arround the sprite.

I aimed for the best compromise between visual looks and fitting em to the cell-structure, so the player always gets a feel for the cell squares, even with buildings that are rotated by several degrees.
So it also serves gameplay.

Will ad more randomly selectable bibs in the future for the 1x1 bibs, so each building's dirt pile is unique!

Code-wise, I decided against adding an unnecessary additional "minibib"-trait, but to use the already existing code for the bib with only minimal changes (to check if it has the "minibib"-sequence in the yaml-file). I think this is the cleanest approach.

Changed some offset-values in sequences\structures.yaml to make some minibibs look better.
Also fixed the service depot-footprint and offset it a bit, so it looks good and finally has its xxx, xxx footprint which you would expect.

Minibib does not look good on walls by principle, on sam (needs a special bib which i will commit some time in the future) and camo pillbox (interferes with camo transparency), so these buildings are an exeption.

Also, since it is looking so much better, i changed Radar dome & tech center's bib to minibibs.
You almost always have only one of these buildings, so this will not affect gameplay in any way.

In the make:
Same for CnC-mod.

Screenshots:
![temperat](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1968396/2148252/645bb648-93e1-11e3-85a6-b5f45ac3b62f.PNG)
![snow](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1968396/2148257/77fcd984-93e1-11e3-86e7-62a45886b71b.PNG)
![desert](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1968396/2148260/8414821c-93e1-11e3-957b-ff5de74a7acd.PNG)
![interior](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1968396/2148265/98b6d486-93e1-11e3-9df0-0741195beae7.PNG)

data.title: Automatically upgrade outdated custom map rules
data.body:
This would fix a lot of crashes.
- Add a RulesVersion key to map.yaml (just a date, without release/playtest).
- Have the map parser check this at startup and:
  - Ignore the map if the date is newer than the current engine version.
  - Upgrade the map rules using the `--upgrade-map` command if the date is older than the current engine version.
- This should only be applied to user-installed maps (requires #4635).
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1407244-automatically-upgrade-outdated-custom-map-rules?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Add user/system map directory annotation
data.body: This would allow us to split system/user maps in the map chooser, and to apply rule upgrades only to user maps.  This can be implemented using the same syntax as the package hash types.

data.title: Add --upgrade-* conversion for CrateDrop -> CrateSpawner.
data.body: See #4360 and bd334a62951a8dbd052feb57ca3176cddc0ee0aa.

data.title: Replay viewer: Functional UI *Pause + Fast Foreward
data.body:
In order to fully appreciate a replay of a game you need to be able to go back and forth on the game's timeline. A timeline-bar of some kind would do the trick.

*edited 2/13/2014: In light knowing that picking spots on a timebar is incompatible with the current engine I thusly alter the issue to adding pause(F3 doesn't work with the replay viewer) and a fast forward function. Preferably with buttons close to the map tab. Bounty stays the same. Good luck!

data.title: Map +Oil Rigs version. Corrected access to bridges for repairs and terra...
data.body:
## Poland Raid v4 changes:
- access to bridges from south has been corrected for engineers
- added Oil Rigs with custom cash-trickler
- some terrain modifications to improve balance for starting zones
  - graphical comparsion is avalible at http://content.open-ra.org/?p=maps
- ore fields is now more balanced
- ore values are slighty reduced for map needs
- starting cash is set to 4000 and starting units restricted to MCV only
  - the last rule is to give spotters bigger chance to go opposite shore before enemy defences will be too strong - and to delay optional destruction of bridges

---

*Please Be cautious with non-naval AI bots, while bridges can be destroyed. It may slow your games until route alghoritms for AI bots will be improved.

data.title: Remove team colour from husks
data.body: As of #4517, husks are now free for any team to capture with an engineer. The colour of the husk should be changed to the neutral colour (grey) to reflect this. This would also aid with target identification mid-battle, which is currently made difficult by the similarity of husks to units being hit by a shell.

data.title: chronoshift wont teleport infantry
Upgrade the sln to VS 2012
data.body:
I would like @Unit158 to check if they can't open this upgraded sln in Visual C# 2010 Express. If they can't then this patch works. If not we can explore using the `MinimumVisualStudioVersion` setting.
Closes #4567

data.title: Support IMA ADPCM playback
data.body: Needed for weapon sounds from C&C Generals.

data.title: more modifiable uncloak trait
data.body:
currently vehicles can uncloak while firing, could we have it so that an APC picking up or dropping off troops uncloaks, that could possibly be done by making certain frames trigger decloaking that the modder puts after the trait, like this:

Uncloak:
       Frame: 69, 74, 79, etc

assuming the unload anim is 5 frames long and starts at 69 or whatever

data.title: Update CHANGELOG
data.body: Changed to show the results of the PR I made regarding Obelisk HP

data.title: Update structures.yaml
data.body: During mid/end game, it is often need to build Silo after Silo if cash is flowing faster than needs. Vocal warning 'silo is needed' is then very annoying if ones have no time to build those siloses, so - while it is not critical structure - imho it should have at least slight more capacity. I would give 2500 for both PROC and SILO, but 1500 -> 2000 for silo would be good start for test it (in private version I am using 2500 for both, and it is 100% adorable by me while not changing gameplay significantly).

data.title: Map +Oil Rigs version. Corrected access to bridges for repairs.
data.body: Map is now detaily tested in multiple lan games in cybercafe for any bugs. Works great and it is now most favourite map in this cybercafe by ffa players.

data.title: Handle "System.InvalidOperationException: No suitable renderers were found"
data.body:
Old graphics hardware or drivers cause a crash to desktop as seen in #4618. This should be handled gracefully, informing users of the issue and how to fix it if possible. 

Some older Intel embedded graphics chips don't support GLSL and require the use of the Cg renderer. Fallback should be handled automatically, with the user informed if the application requires being restarted. If this is not supported, the user should be informed that they don't have the minimum hardware requirements.

data.title: Per-cell infantry attack orders
data.body:
Currently, if a cell contains one or more enemy infantry units, when attempting to attack, the player can mis-click on some of the empty space in the cell, resulting in a move command instead of an attack command. Higher resolutions with small sprite sizes exacerbate this problem. It is especially problematic for helicopters when attacking rocket soldiers.

This behaviour could be improved if the attack cursor was shown when over any part of a cell containing enemy infantry. It the cell contains more than one infantry unit, the attack order should be aimed at the infantry unit nearest the mouse position.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1406159-per-cell-infantry-attack-orders?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

OpenRA.Utility should expand out * in paths

data.title: OpenRA has Encounted a fatal error and must close.
data.body:
I cannot get OpenRA to launch,  I was able to before (twice) and the only change I made was trying to tell OpenRA to use the GDI95.iso for the sound tracks and music, when I loaded the mod Tiberium Dawn (which failed), that and I had opened the Auto run and tried running the GDI95.iso when mounted which was a pain to fix.  This is what I get in my exception.log which is the only log file which has any data:

Tiberian Dawn Mod at Version release-20131223
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 2.0.50727.5472
Exception of type `System.IO.FileNotFoundException`: File not found: speech.mix
   at OpenRA.FileFormats.FileSystem.OpenWithExts(String filename, String[] exts)
   at OpenRA.FileFormats.FileSystem.Open(String filename)
   at OpenRA.FileFormats.MixFile..ctor(String filename, PackageHashType type, Int32 priority)
   at OpenRA.FileFormats.FileSystem.OpenPackage(String filename, String annotation, Int32 order)
   at OpenRA.FileFormats.FileSystem.<Mount>c__AnonStorey18.<>m__29()
   at OpenRA.FileFormats.FileSystem.Mount(String name, String annotation)
   at OpenRA.FileFormats.FileSystem.LoadFromManifest(Manifest manifest)
   at OpenRA.ModData.PrepareMap(String uid)
   at OpenRA.Game.StartGame(String mapUID, Boolean isShellmap)
   at OpenRA.Game.LoadShellMap()
   at OpenRA.Mods.Cnc.CncLoadScreen.TestAndContinue()
   at OpenRA.Mods.Cnc.CncLoadScreen.StartGame()
   at OpenRA.Game.InitializeWithMod(String mod)
   at OpenRA.Game.Initialize(Arguments args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

I have tried logging off and back on, rebooting, and reinstalling with no success.

data.title: Replay viewer: Fix the chat playback
data.body: The chat interaction in replay needs to correspond to when the chat text actually happened in the game's timeline.
